result.execSummary:
The defendant Diane L. Ferrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Joint & Several with Co-Deft, Arnez Miller 22CF897

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Participate in and successfully complete the Marathon County Drug Court Recovery Program; participation in program includes attending and presenting to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months after successful graduation. These 3 occasions would be at the 1, 3 and 6 month mark or additional times at agents discretion.  

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  

No contact with A.H.  

No contact with co-deft, Arnez Miller.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diane L. Ferrell

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:48 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Shari Post. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI: 
Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)
Count 4 (Theft-Movable Property <=$2500/Repeater)
Count 5 (Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition/Repeater)
COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 

Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC/Repeater)>>>GUILTY.  
Count 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC/Repeater)>>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation.  

CONDITIONS:  Participate in and successfully complete the Marathon County Drug Court Recovery Program; participation in program includes attending and presenting to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months after successful graduation. These 3 occasions would be at the 1, 3 and 6 month mark or additional times at agents discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  No contact with A.H.  No contact with co-deft, Arnez Miller.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Restitution in the amount of $110.21 plus 10% surcharge to A.H.; Joint and Several with co-deft, Arnez Miller (22CF897). 

Adj:  4:06 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

INCLUDES 22CF896 & 22CT198.  No contact with victim(s):  A.J.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
